location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Resident at Bushire, at Bombay to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage, which has resulted in a hole in the fabric of the folio. As a result, the address of the letter has been slightly obscured.

mods.abstract: The letter is informing the Bombay Government that the Resident has been summoned to the Recorder's Court at Bombay by Abdull Rahim Khaun [‘Abd al-Raḥīm Khān] son of the late Mohomed Nabbee Khaun [Muḥammad Nabī Khān]; the case concerns a claim over a company pension awarded to the latter. A request is conveyed for a copy of instructions issued on the matter to the Resident by the Governor of Bombay, so the Resident may use it in his defence.
